skill.name: pr-prepare
skill.description: Prepare pull request descriptions following project template. Activates on: prepare PR, create PR, pull request, ready for PR, draft PR, write PR
skill.summary: Prepare pull request descriptions following project template. Activates on: prepare PR, create PR, p...
skill.author: ByronWilliamsCPA

security_audit.summary: This is a prompt-only skill with no executable code. The skill consists of markdown instructions that guide AI behavior when preparing PR descriptions. It only runs read-only git commands (status, log, diff) to analyze local repository state.

content.value_statement: Writing clear PR descriptions takes time and consistency varies across team members. This skill automatically generates standardized PR descriptions by analyzing git changes and applying project templates.
actual_capabilities: Analyzes git changes using status, log, and diff commands
Generates structured PR descriptions from project template
Suggests conventional commit titles based on change type
Identifies modified components and their impact
Supports Linear issue integration with issue linking
limitations: Requires git repository with changes to analyze
Does not push code or create PRs on remote servers
Template structure is fixed to the provided format
No built-in support for custom PR templates per repository

use_cases.title: Standardize Team PR Descriptions
use_cases.description: Ensure every pull request follows consistent formatting with automatically generated summaries and change details.

use_cases.title: Create Clear Contribution Descriptions
use_cases.description: Generate professional PR descriptions that help maintainers quickly understand and review your contributions.

use_cases.title: Streamline PR Review Workflow
use_cases.description: Get clear, structured change summaries that make it easier to understand context before diving into code review.

prompt_templates.title: Basic PR Prep
prompt_templates.prompt: Prepare the PR for this branch. Include a summary, list of changed files, impact assessment, and suggested title.

prompt_templates.title: Bug Fix PR
prompt_templates.prompt: Prepare a PR describing this bug fix. Explain what was broken, what changed, and why this fixes the issue.

prompt_templates.title: Documentation Update
prompt_templates.prompt: Prepare a documentation-only PR. The changes are only in markdown files. Suggest an appropriate commit type.

prompt_templates.title: Refactoring PR
prompt_templates.prompt: Prepare a PR for these refactoring changes. Focus on what was restructured and why, without adding new features.

output_examples.input: Prepare the PR for this branch
output: - Optional notes and Linear issue link

best_practices: Include specific file names and what changed in each component
List all testing and validation performed before submitting
Note any known issues, limitations, or follow-up work needed
anti_patterns: Using vague summaries like 'updated code' or 'made changes'
Missing information about what files changed and why
Submitting without running tests or linting checks

faq.question: Which AI platforms support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Activate with phrases like 'prepare PR' or 'create pull request'.

faq.question: What does the skill actually do?
faq.answer: Runs git commands to analyze changes, then generates a formatted PR description following the project template.

faq.question: Does it integrate with Linear issues?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill asks if you want to link a Linear issue and adds 'Closes TMPL-[NUMBER]' to the description.

faq.question: Can I customize the PR template?
faq.answer: Edit the SKILL.md file to modify the template structure. Changes apply to all future PRs prepared by the skill.

faq.question: Does it create PRs on GitHub?
faq.answer: No. The skill generates the description text. You copy it to GitHub or use 'gh pr create --fill' to create the PR.

faq.question: What types of PRs can it handle?
faq.answer: Features, bug fixes, documentation, refactoring, performance improvements, tests, and maintenance tasks.
